name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump’s particular maladies have created a moment in which Biden’s greatest strengths as a person are most needed by the nation. Things like decency, honor, respect, and, yes, empathy are on the ballot," @Peter_Wehner writes: https://t.co/gyKFZ9nA5I

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Trump needs to squeeze even more votes out of rural and small-town America to offset his losses elsewhere, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/OqeBTNmGf1

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Obsessing over the probabilities of unique one-off events that we have an infinitesimally small amount of individual control over—like a presidential election—is a metaphysically strange thing to do," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/9ndejv9Xws

name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump may wage a war of disinformation if election results don’t go his way, @McKayCoppins warns—and the “Army for Trump” is gearing up to help. https://t.co/4iTsEwHvHK

name: TheAtlantic
text: The news media are not overblowing the pandemic’s severity ahead of Election Day. That and more in @realcpaz’s tracker of Trump’s lies: https://t.co/00WE4qK7Ry

name: TheAtlantic
text: David Jay, a founder of the asexual movement, “wanted kids and also wanted a co-parent to help him raise kids, but wasn’t interested in romantic partnership.” So he created his own three-parent household, Angela Chen reported in September. https://t.co/LlyKVBHmR5

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch: The 2020 presidential race could be remembered as a hinge point in the nation’s history. Tomorrow at 11 ET, join Atlantic senior editor @RonBrownstein, assistant editor @realcpaz, and staff writer @DkThomp for a live Election Day discussion. https://t.co/VMXwqz7q7Q

name: TheAtlantic
text: The American election isn't just crucial for Americans. In many ways, it is an existential vote for Britain, too, @TomMcTague writes: https://t.co/vgO6wVTvmD

name: TheAtlantic
text: “In public, Biden and his senior advisers profess full confidence in the electoral system to work as it always has,” @bartongellman writes. “Behind the scenes, they are preparing for the worst.” https://t.co/4zewL5B1WX

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @realcpaz: It’s Election Day in America. Here’s how @TheAtlantic’s journalists will watch the results unfold.  https://t.co/7yAD0JJYop

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "This year, it is incumbent on the press to respect each citizen’s constitutional right to vote by not 'calling' this election based on early or incomplete data under pressure from President Trump." --  @kimwehle:
https://t.co/QqLdu89Blu

name: TheAtlantic
text: How can you actually figure out what's happening tonight? @NickBaumann and The Atlantic's Politics team have some advice: https://t.co/8BR8Hpf0dI

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Instead of identifying with an old notion of the American dream, new citizens like me can advance a truer story," @azhang852 writes: https://t.co/YBF39ck2wv
